description: Works perfectly well. Has never let me down.
summary: Use it as my daily drive risen due to work needs

description:
I have followed EACH and EVERY step, and the install process is stupid simple, on Fedora 35; and yet...

Everything is properly installed, yet the application will not launch DESPITE the fact that it requests the admin password (as it should) before it even begins to run. After entering password, bupkis. nada, nothing.

I love TorGuard and all, but their Linux devs... OOOF, big OOOF

To be clear I've had issues on Arch, Fedora, OpenSUSE... basically anything not debian, this software struggles way to much with for a simple install.

Yes I've already followed troubleshooting steps, but to no avail.
summary: well it's a great piece of kit, when linux distros aren't breaking it

description: It's a good VPN app with a good support, they have clinets for all OSs and that's an important thing for me.
Its Affordable and has cross platform support. Was a little 'buggy' on first install, after reinstalling works as intended.
